summary: Based on the provided documents, J. B. Hotis is mentioned in the context of FBI documents provided to the U.S. Senate Select Committee on Intelligence Activities (SSC) in 1975. These documents pertain to investigations into Martin Luther King Jr.'s alleged connections with Stanley Levison and alleged Communist ties. The documents detail FBI efforts to furnish materials establishing factual basis for Levison's secret CPUSA membership. The documents also discuss the authority of Congress, particularly the Senate Select Committee chaired by Senator Frank Church, to declassify and release classified information, along with a legal memorandum prepared by the CIA's General Counsel on the subject. The documents also transmit 23 documents to the Senate Select Committee (SSC) regarding contacts between the FBI, the President, and the Department of State on the subject of legal attaches during 1971.
